intro: Vincetoxicum xanthotrichum, commonly known as golden hairroot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, often colorful flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, featuring hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive golden hue on their undersides. Its flowers are usually clustered in umbels and bloom in late spring to early summer. Vincetoxicum xanthotrichum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display.
